result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig S. Fhlug was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No abusive, violent or harrassing contact with the victim, C.F.
Absolute Sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs.

Shall successfully complete and discharge from probation on companion counts.
Shall file bi-monthly written reports with the District Attorney.

No contact with C.F. or her residence without the approval of Agent, except for court hearings for divorce case.
Absolute Sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs.
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle.
No Taverns meaning the defendant shall not enter into or loiter near any establishment where the main purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol, including liquor stores.
Shall not possess or consume any controlled substance or paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

Any other assessment/treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Child visitation exchange to be arranged through a 3rd party at a neutral site.
Domestic Violence Assessment & follow-thru with any recommended treatment or counseling.
Cognitive Intervention treatment.
DNA Sample/Surcharge - no sample necessary if previously provided.
Any fine/costs/restitution still owing at time of discharge/revocation shall be converted to a civil judgment and be collected by the Clerk of Court Office.
Pay Supervision Fees as determined by DOC.
AODA Assessment & follow-thru with any recommended treatment or counseling.

timeConds.notes:
W/Huber - 4 MONTHS STAYED - Court reserves the right to impose upon recommendation of Agent.
No GPS allowed the first 4 months.
Begin within 30 days.
